Roadmap to Decentralization

Neil Zumwalde I 08.30.2021

Let’s imagine the world in 2023: DAOs have matured into a way for stakeholders to cross the chasm between a customer and a service provider, between a venture fund and an opportunity, between a social group and a cause. They allow for the members to offer support and thoughtful decision making on the future of a protocol, investment, or service; as a group we share in the success, and tackle challenges as a group.

Credmark will be among the DAO avant-garde.

Becoming a successful DAO is difficult, and It’s our opinion that you need several different things.

First off, you need a goal; an axiom; a first principle. Ours is to make high integrity DeFi data modeling accessible. Why? Because it’s necessary in order to understand the risks associated with DeFi and to take action to transform those risks into well-reasoned opportunities.

Secondly, a DAO needs a community. We’re building one through developer engagement and token based incentivization

Thirdly, you need automated governance. No one person should be able to stand in the way of the will of the community.

Three years from now, Credmark will exist as a totally decentralized data modeling platform. This means that we need to set intermediate benchmarks for product, decentralization, and community building to create a robust, high integrity dataset and make it available to applications and users.

This is our plan to do it. It’s ambitious, and so are we.

Critically, we’re building decentralized data modeling infrastructure. Large scale computing infrastructure has proven to be the difficult thing to make transparent and traceable, but we’re up for the challenge. By offering permission-less access to data, traceable and open software and community support, we can build the most robust data modeling platform in the world. It’s a platform that is transparent, traceable, and provable enough to withstand the test of time.

We are working to generate immutable, verifiable proof of off-chain data infrastructure, and ownership of user-generated data methodologies. As our infrastructure grows, so does the value of being a part of it.

Data Scientists, and developers have the skills to provide value to capital holders both retail and institutional, but don’t have a way to provide those models across in the industry. Credmark is building the platform to create, backtest, and verify the efficacy of data models on DeFi data, then attribute ownership to the creator permissionlessly, and finally deliver the data to the interested parties or applications.

We’ve kicked off our platform with an example: Smartpool for Uniswap v3.

Uniswap v3 magnifies the financial risk of impermanent loss significantly, and doesn’t have the ease of use of its predecessor, so it was the perfect candidate for our first models.

Smartpool is a DeFi solution that allows users to create positions using a set of basic financial analysis. The analysis can be consumed and expanded using the Credmark Developer Platform, which will launch in year two.

Our models over the next year will be created by the Credmark Team, winners of our competitions, and partners until the self-service developer platform is complete.

Our priority list of models can be voted on by governance, but in the meantime these are the planned Model Categories:

Decentralized Exchanges (Such as Uniswap, SushiSwap) whose risks include

  • Impermanent Loss, Frontrunning, and Slippage

Lending Platforms (Aave and Compound) with risks like

  • Reserve Solvency, Liquidation Risks, and Liquidation Reward Incentivization

Yield Aggregators (Yearn)

  • Multiplicative and Additive Risk Aggregation, and Dilution

Stablecoins (USDC, DAI, USDT)

  • Liquidity, Algorithmic vs Asset Backed, Secured Asset Risk, Leverage, and Losing the Peg

Volatile Cryptocurrencies and Tokens

  • Liquidity Risk, Correlated Assets, Centralization, and Market Risk

Cross-Chain Exchanges

  • Known Exploits

You, the Credmark community, are our accountability. We’re building the structure that will ensure that all users of DeFi can analyze the risks associated with platforms both new and established, but only our community can ensure that access to those metrics are transparent and fairly distributed.

Decision making will be handled by our community upon the launch of distributed governance. Staking mechanisms reward members for meaningful participation. Meaningful participation includes creation of models, creation of liquidity, decision making, DAO operations, and finally, and most importantly: consuming the output of the models themselves.

Partnerships with DAOs and Businesses are handled as Community Partnership Agreements. This brings our partners into our community and aligns incentives using token swaps and toolsets to bridge communities.

CMK will be used by consumers to access data, reward developers, and to ensure operational efficiency. By using a dynamic token, we can allow our developers and data consumers to gain long-term access to data and value that grows with the platform itself.

Decentralization will be a long road, but at Credmark, we’re doing things the hard way, in order to do them the right way.
